alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 2:16PM CDT until May 21 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Illinois, including the following counties, Madison, Monroe and Saint Clair. Portions of east central Missouri, including the following counties and independent city, Jefferson, Saint Louis and Saint Louis City. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Minor street flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 PM CDT, an area of showers and thunderstorms was moving into the St Louis metro area. Heavy rainfall earlier today has led to wet conditions with creeks and streams still at high levels. The additional rainfall is expected to cause minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. This may include ponding of water on city streets. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Louis, Florissant, Chesterfield, Belleville, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Granite City, O`Fallon, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, East St. Louis, Hazelwood, Collinsville, Edwardsville, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Arnold, Manchester and Creve Coeur.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
